summary: Need UI designs for bash command visualization â†’ Created two complete terminal container designs (macOS-style and Windows 11-style) with responsive layouts

solution.approach: Created standalone HTML/CSS design files in tests/design/terminal/ folder with two complete style variants and multiple usage examples
key_changes: tests/design/terminal/terminal-container.html: macOS-style terminal with traffic light controls, clean dark theme, monospace fonts
tests/design/terminal/terminal-styles.css: Modern terminal styling (#1e1e1e bg, #4ec9b0 prompts, responsive breakpoints)
tests/design/terminal/windows/terminal-container.html: Windows 11-style with tabbed interface, PowerShell/CMD variants, window controls
tests/design/terminal/windows/terminal-styles.css: Windows theming (#0c0c0c bg, #0078d4 prompts, tab system with hover states)

validation: Visual inspection by opening HTML files in browser, user confirmed design approval with 'love it!'

gotchas.issue: Initially started using Task/Explore agent for research when user said 'new feature'
gotchas.solution: User clarified no exploration needed - proceeded directly to design creation

lesson: When user says 'design only, no functionality', focus purely on static HTML/CSS mockups without backend integration concerns

key_patterns: .terminal-container - Main wrapper with border-radius and shadow
.terminal-prompt - Command input display with prompt symbol

next_logical_steps: Integrate terminal container design into actual bash command execution UI
Add streaming output support for real-time command execution display
Implement collapsible terminal containers similar to thinking containers

architecture_decisions.two_style_variants: Created both macOS and Windows styles to give flexibility based on user platform or preference
architecture_decisions.responsive_design: Mobile-first approach with breakpoints at 768px and 480px for tablet/mobile support
architecture_decisions.no_javascript: Pure HTML/CSS designs allow easy integration into any framework without dependencies
architecture_decisions.separate_folders: Isolated macOS and Windows designs in separate folders for clarity and maintainability
